programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "The Mystery of the Haunted Crossing" - In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Dark Waters" - A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Pigman, The Series: Bucks for the Brave
programme.desc: Pigman heads to South Texas to partake in Bucks for the Brave alongside some of the Nation's finest Heroes, Trinity Oaks and Donald Trump Jr.

programme.title: Bone Collector: WADDELL ELK TOUR 2
programme.desc: Michael Waddell hits the road in September for a 2019 Elk tour! Look out Colorado, Arizona, and Utah! (part 2)

programme.title: Bone Collector: GEEZER RIDGE 2
programme.desc: Nick Mundt and Cohen Stone head to a very special place in the heart of Alaska known as Geezer Ridge! Giant Alaskan bull moose with a bow! (part 1)

programme.title: Guns & Ammo TV: Marlin 1895 Dark Series
programme.desc: We take a closer look at the Marlin 1895 Dark Series At The Range. We feature another historical Marlin firearm to celebrate 150 years. In the Pros vs. Joes competition, Jesse Harrison gives cameraman Matt Young all that he can handle at the heavy duty dueling tree.

programme.title: Gun Stories: Influential Semiautomatic Pistols Part 2
programme.desc: Joe Mantegna continues to revisit classic semiatuomatic pistols from the last 100 years.

programme.title: Zona's Awesome Fishing Show: Seth Feider - Michigan
programme.desc: You can be guaranteed of a t.i.m.e. anytime Seth Feider is a guest on the show. Mix him up with Z and an endless supply of Smallmouth and you have the receipe for greatness.

programme.title: In-Fisherman TV: Fire in the Hole & Hold On
programme.desc: The In-Fisherman staff takes you in search of explosive fishing, as they hook up with rampaging smallmouths that canât resist aggressive fishing tactics. Thereâs action from Summer Peak largemouths that go for jig-and-softbait combos casted to cover edges. And it some of the fastest fish catching of the season as we pitch jigs to shallow prespawn crappies.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Best Boat: Arrowglass 24, Sea Born SX281, Belzona 40CCâ¨
programme.desc: Today, on Florida Sportsman Best Boat...For anglers and their families who are interested in adventuring outside of the inlet, we will be taking a look at the Arrowglass 248 CC If you are serious about offshore fishing, but require comfort for the family, we'll be taking a look at the Sea Born SX281 Offshore For serious boaters who want to enjoy time on the water, but not give up the ability to fish, we will be taking a look at Belzona 40CC.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Best Boat: Salt Marsh Heron 18, Dusky 25T, Blackfin 332
programme.desc: Today, on Florida Sportsman Best Boat… for anglers with an addiction to stalking gamefish that roam the skinniest of waters, we’ll be taking a look at the Salt Marsh Heron 18 for those serious about offshore sportfishing, we’ll be looking at the Dusky 252T and…if you require a very capable bluewater fishing machine that doesn’t give up family features, we’ll be taking a look at the Blackfin 332CC.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Watermen: The Heart of Miami
programme.desc: Artist Eric Estrada shows Capt Sam Atwell around his local waters of Miami in search of Tarpon, Bonefish, and Permit to discuss the impacts of industrial runoff into the bay.

programme.title: Greg McHale's Wild Yukon: My Hunting Partners are Huskies: Wood Bison
programme.desc: Wood Bison: North America's largest land animal. Greg and Magnus strap on their skis and are pulled by small teams of sled dogs into the heart of bison country on a winter bison hunt. Dealing with bitter cold, deep snow and the early arrival of a first-born child to one of the team members, Greg has to keep it together in his mission to harvest this incredible species.

programme.title: Pigman: The Series: Get to the Choppa!
programme.desc: The boys are back in town. Angry Bird, Craig and the Heli-Hunter crew welcome back Pigman & Dap for some fan favorite aerial eradication.

programme.title: Big Deer TV: Best of Big Deer
programme.desc: Every hunting season has ups and downs and highs and lows. Mike and crew roll with the punches and enjoy it all.

programme.title: Sporting Chef, The: Low Country for Old Men
programme.desc: Scott pays tribute to Carolina Low Country cuisine. Stacy makes Beer Braised Venison Stew, Susie has more fun than anyone, Brad checks in from Canada, John pounds his schnitzel, Kyle plays with knives and Buddy’s got crabs…and crawfish.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman The Watermen: Crystal River sight fishing with Capt. Lacey Kelly
programme.desc: The lush grass flats and thriving fisheries in the Crystal River area are a prime example of successful restoration and conservation efforts. Explore the amazing sight fishing and beautiful flats with Capt. Lacey Kelly and Capt. Kayla McGuire.

programme.title: The Fin Chasers: Montauk Redbone Tournament Part 2
programme.desc: Part 2 of the FCA Montauk Slam. Capt. Frank & Capt. Anthony Grassi head to Montauk, NY to participate in this charity tournament to benefit Cystic Fibrosis. Chef Kerry Heffernan and Chef Harold Dieterle join Capt. Frank for some pre-tournament fishing and eating!

programme.title: Guns and Ammo: .50MG Out to 2+ Miles
programme.desc: The hit TV show Bonanza influenced many of us during our formative years and we get some hands-on experience with several of the guns that made that show great. Bryan Morgan launches a .50BMG and impacts a sub-MOA target at almost 2.2 miles away.

programme.title: Silver Kings S6:E3 "Shake N Bake"
programme.desc: Jared is joined by well known tarpon angler Baker Bishop in Islamorada.

programme.title: Guidelines S3:E5 "Full Send"
programme.desc: Early Spring Weather Window sends Capt. Jay into the "Tall Waters" of the Gulf of Mexico with Capt. Jason Stock out of Anna Maria Island Fl in search of some Blackfin Tuna.

programme.title: Kingfish Mayhem TV S1:E3 "Land of the Giants"
programme.desc: Key West is known as the "land of the giants," but will Four Reel Fishing Team and Sweet Caroline Fishing Team be able to find them? Jump aboard the pro series teams jockey for position at the Key West Kingfish Mayhem.

programme.title: Into the Blue S13:E3 "Wrecks of Hawks Cay"
programme.desc: The near shore wrecks of Hawks Cay is the place to be when the wind is blowing.

programme.title: Two Conchs Sportfishing TV S3:E9 " First Mate Tucker's 17th Birthday"
programme.desc: Captain Jack Carlson is planning a special day out on the water for his son Tucker, it's his 17th birthday and they're going to celebrate Two Conchs style. The game plan is to do 3 different kinds of fishing with he and his friends offshore, deep dropping and spearfishing. With this being the last year until Tucker makes the jump from First Mate to Captain, Jack wants this day to be one for the books.

programme.title: Local Knowledge S6:E3 "If This Boat Could Talk"
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E4
programme.desc: Peter travels 220 miles by boat to Harbour Island, Bahamas trolling for big kingfish, live baiting for tuna and bottom fish for big mutton snapper along the reef. Afterwards they take a swim with and hand feed the famous Green Sea Turtles and cut up some tuna on the way in for some sunset sashimi. PART 1

programme.title: Florida Sport Fishing S9:E3 "Bahamas Deep Drop"
programme.desc: Join Capt. Mike and the crew as they travel across the gulf stream to the islands of the Bahamas.

programme.title: Florida Sport Fishing S9:E4 "Yellowfin Fever"
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and the crew head across the stream in search of trophy yellowfin tuna!

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E5 "From Flats Skiffs to Wakeboards"
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson pole the crystal clear flats off Marathon in the Florida Keys using the Two Conchs Yellowfin 17 skiff. The brothers also visit Keys Cable Park to try their hand at wakeboarding.

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E6 "Marathon Permit and Key West Fish Dip"
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson head offshore Marathon to fish for permit on the wrecks. The brothers also visit Key West to sample and rate smoked fish dip from local hot spots.

programme.title: Into the Blue S13:E10 "Swingin' It" Part. 1
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger invite Pro Golf player Gene Sauers to a glass calm day with plenty of fish.

programme.title: Gale Force Twins S1:E4 "Explore A Bottomless Blue Hole - Chub Cay, Bahamas"
programme.desc: What better way to complete our trip to Chub Cay than to explore the local BLUE HOLE! Said to be around 800 ft deep and rumored to house GIANT SQUID, TIGER SHARKS AND GOLIATH GROUPERS this blue hole was a MUST DO. We showed up prepared with our camera's, mask and fins ready to explore this natural sink hole. The question is...WHAT DID WE FIND?? I guess you'll have to watch and find outfor yourselves... https://www.galeforcefishing.com

programme.title: Innerlocs Outthere S1:E3 "Bowfishing 101"
programme.desc: Corey and Camryn talk about their love for Bowfishing. Bowfishing 101 is full go tips, tactics and Action

programme.title: Road Trips S1:E3 "Cameraman Turned Bowhunter | Brown's Biggest Buck Ever"
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown have been playing cat and mouse with "Big Heavy" throughout their Nebraska trip. During some midday downtime, Brown wins a bet with Jordan on a 50-yard shot to earn himself the right to be in the hot seat. The guys continue making adjustments to get close to the buck. It results in Brown tagging his biggest buck ever.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E3 "A Story Of Restoration Master"
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E4 "Run-N-Gun Master"
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. From fishing to waterfowl, we have found that every hunt gives us a chance to experience other people's stories. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.

programme.title: Browning Films S3:E3 "Against The Crane"
programme.desc: Nellie the dog saves Stefan’s life from a crane as the guys are down in Lubbock Texas.

programme.title: Browning Films S3:E4 "Broad Valley"
programme.desc: Honk Stomper Guide Service helps the guys get on some geese in Moses Lake, Washington.

programme.title: Local Lines S1:E3 "Shallow Water Studs"
programme.desc: In this episode Captain Brandon Branch takes one of his good buddies from Diamond Fishing Products out for some Shallow Grouper action over in Crystal River Florida. Year after year this style of fishing is becoming more popular and provides trophy quality fish in less than 10ft of water

programme.title: Larry Smith Outdoors S1:E3 "Walleyes With Issac Lakich And Justin Schneider"
programme.desc: Do you want to learn how to catch more walleyes using livescope? We teamed up with Isaac Lakich and Justin Schneider from Head to Head fishing and Warrior Boats pro staff members and went to Cedar River, MI to target GIANT walleyes! Using our livescope and other electronics we were able to specifically target the fish we wanted to catch and, man was it fun!

programme.title: Downton Dixie S1:E1 "Welcome To Downton Dixie"

programme.desc: There’s a dream home—and there’s a dream location. CABIN TRUCKERS follows the incredible exploits of hauling colossal cabins to remote, picturesque locations. Watch as an expert team navigates through extremely rocky, mountainous terrain, delivering ...

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy journeys from L.A. to Orange County to discover how two non-profit innovators are tackling the problem of food waste. Roy visits Robert Egger, whose project LA Kitchen is simultaneously aggregating wasted food, using it to cook fresh meals for those in need, and providing workforce training. Roy also visits Bill Bracken of Bracken’s Kitchen who partners with Chefs to End Hunger to reuse leftover food and distribute it with his food truck in Orange County. Roy also visits with Richard Garcia at Alma Backyard Farms in Compton where kids are learning how food in grown by digging in to Alma’s hands-on program.

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy takes a head-on look at efforts to heal the social and economic wounds of Watts, acknowledging one of the oldest communities in Los Angeles as a mirror into ourselves and our future. Led by activist Aqeela Sherrills, Roy visits with Sherrills' mother as she prepares free food for the community, digs into the soul of what makes Watts Coffee House a cornerstone in the neighborhood and examines the missed opportunities of the Jordan Downs Housing Project redevelopment. Sharing the "real" story of his own restaurant Locol and where it stands within the community of Watts, Roy reflects as he connects with the very people navigating the most pressing issues facing our food systems.

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy explores the power of cooking to rehabilitate those on the margins of society and the organizations taking a chance on those who need it most. Roy spends time with Father Greg Boyle of Homeboy and Homegirl Industries, the pioneer of socially minded food enterprises focused on transitioning former gang members from lives on the street to lives in kitchens. Roy also visits Mar Diego, a former drug dealer-turned-food entrepreneur who has opened Dough Girl, a pizza shop in the San Fernando Valley employing local kids struggling with drug use and homelessness. The episode also features L.A. Mayor Eric Garcetti shedding light into workforce models with a purpose.

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy meets the individuals bringing healthy and affordable food options into South L.A. communities that lack access to fresh food. The journey begins with revolutionary sidewalk gardener Ron Finley on a mission to inspire change, one sidewalk plot at a time. Roy also visits with vegan grocer Olympia Auset, whose startup Süprmarkt delivers healthy and affordable food to the doorsteps of her community. Finally, Roy visits Earle’s Hot Dogs, a vegetarian hot dog cart that has grown over its 30-year history into a multi-location brick and mortar shop, now a staple of a community hungry for healthier options.

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy explores future culinary landscapes looking forward to a world affected by climate change. Roy spends an evening with chefs Henry Fischer and Anna Rose Hopkins from Hank and Bean who make a surprising plant-forward dinner featuring non-traditional protein sources like crickets and jellyfish. Roy also visits with Ethan Brown of Beyond Meat, a company pioneering the plant-based replacements for our favorite burgers and sausages, and Vegan Hooligans, a pop-up restaurant in eastside LA’s Eagle Rock making classic American diner food out of entirely plant-based ingredients.

programme.title: Broken Bread
programme.desc: Roy visits Chris Yang’s Pop Cultivate to explore the emergence of a new culinary landscape since the advent of legalized recreational marijuana. Roy tackles the gentrification of cannabis culture by visiting Med Men, the leader in upscale legal weed retailers in Los Angeles. An interview with Virgil Grant, a formerly incarcerated weed dealer now seeking to run a legal distribution business, sheds light on efforts to build cannabis equity for those hit hardest by the War on Drugs. The episode also features interviews with actor/activist Cheech Marin and Shep Gordon.

programme.title: Broken Bread

Roy also visits with Richard Garcia at Alma Backyard Farms in Compton where kids are learning how food in grown by digging in to Alma’s hands-on program.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella treats her friends to an Italian inspired supper of pork loin stuffed with Parma ham and oregano, served alongside her speedy mock mash and lazy person's vignarola.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella shares the secrets of her celebratory, yet simple Italian roast chicken, served alongside a sunny saffron orzotto. Dessert comes courtesy of Nigella's surprisingly easy coffee ice cream.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella reveals a secret passion for one of the tastes of Italy with her dark and deviant liquorice pudding before introducing us to the joys of fregola in a light, tomato-hued recipe of couscous with clams.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Vanessa shares some Italian staples, including gnocchi two ways, homemade pesto, and creamy polenta.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Hana Etsuko makes cucumber salad with kelp, a Japanese hotpot, and homemade teriyaki sauce.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Michael prepares dishes inspired by Trentino-Alto Adige.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy

programme.title: A is for Apple

programme.desc: Chef Caroline McCann-Bizjak shares tips for preparing herbs.

programme.desc: Venezuelan-born Juan Pablo Gonzalez is an expert in his home country's national bread, the arepa.

programme.title: The Latin Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Luis Tigretón Leon cooks up three succulent dishes that sure to please any garlic lover.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Lauren Gulyas tackles the challenge of using vanilla & vinegar in the same dish.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Robert Jewell makes a few separate dishes with bacon and bananas before combining them.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Vanessa shares some Italian staples, including gnocchi two ways, homemade pesto, and creamy polenta.

programme.title: Plenty of Garlic and Parm
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster shows host Julia Collin Davison the steps to preparing the Central California regional favorite, Garlic Fried Chicken. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his pick for the best inexpensive Dutch oven on the market. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore prepares an unforgettable fan-requested dish for host Bridget Lancaster, Crispy Parmesan Potatoes.

programme.title: Pub-Style Seafood
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore makes host Bridget Lancaster perfect Fish and Chips. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of hamburger buns. And finally, test cook Christie Morrison makes Julia the ultimate Shrimp Burgers.

programme.title: Canning Classics
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison goes into the test kitchen with test cook Becky Hays to reveal the secrets to making Classic Strawberry Jam at home. Next, gadget expert Lisa McManus uncovers the best canning tools. Finally, test cook Dan Souza shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make the ultimate Bread and Butter Pickles.

programme.title: Korean Feast
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make dolsot bibimbap. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews spider skimmers in the equipment corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza prepares Korean-style fried chicken wings.

programme.title: Ultimate Italian
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes host Bridget Lancaster an Italian classic-Porchetta. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of ricotta. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews wine coolers, and test cook Erin McMurrer uncovers the secrets to Parmesan Farrotto.

programme.title: Japanese Suppers
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster prepare Japanese-style pan-fried chicken cutlets. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for santoku knives. Finally, test cook Keith Dresser makes Bridget miso-marinated salmon.

programme.title: Better Breakfast
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster teach viewers how to make Easy Pancakes. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of turkey bacon. Next, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews syrup dispensers, and science expert Dan Souza demystifies the science of baking soda and browning. Then, test cook Becky Hays makes Julia a decadent version of a breakfast classic: Creamy French-Style Scrambled Eggs.

programme.title: Ham Dinner
programme.desc: Ham dinner-with green bean casserole-is classic American fare. But which kind of ham should you buy? And can you really make a "good" green bean casserole? We show you how.

programme.title: Beef Burgundy
programme.desc: We uncover the secrets to beef Burgundy at its best and show you a way to make portions of it ahead of time.

programme.title: Maple-Glazed Pork Roast
programme.desc: Pork producers have worked so hard to remove fat from their pigs that most pork roasts have little character. Glazing a pork roast with maple syrup is an attractive way to boost flavor, but all too often the meat becomes sweet and candylike. We wanted to perfect this recipe.

programme.title: The Pancakes Show
programme.desc: Few recipes deliver so much pleasure for so little work as pancakes. The batter comes together in minutes, and the cooking time is brief. Why, then, do most Americans never make pancakes from scratch?

programme.title: Grilled Chicken and Salmon
programme.desc: In this episode we prepare grilled chicken with a dipping sauce and grilled salmon with a sweet, sticky glaze.

programme.title: Dinner on a Dime
programme.desc: We investigate inexpensive steaks and also take a look at a classic accompaniment to steak: mashed potatoes.

programme.title: One-Skillet Dinners
programme.desc: When most people think of dishes like lasagna and jambalaya, they think of labor-intensive weekend meals. In this episode, however, we develop versions that could be prepared on a busy weeknight.

programme.title: Best Beef Stew
programme.desc: Beef, beer, and onions have a natural affinity-it's one reason burgers and onion rings are on the menu at nearly every sports bar. In a carbonnade, the heartiness of beef melds with the soft sweetness of sliced onions in a lightly thickened broth that is rich, deep, and satisfying. We aimed to create the very best version of this cold-weather favorite.

programme.title: Chocolate Delights
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to making Foolproof All-Butter Pie Dough and Chocolate Cream Pie, and tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cocoa powder. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Julia a decadent Dark Chocolate Fudge Sauce.

programme.title: The Perfect Cake
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make the perfect Gingerbread Layer Cake and Keith Makes Sticky Toffee Pudding Cakes.

programme.title: The Perfect Cookie
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Julia a festive recipe for Easy Holiday Sugar Cookies. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for parchment paper, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews silicone baking mats. Test cook Lan Lam then makes Bridget the Best Lemon Bars.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Sandwiches
programme.desc: As a child, one of Julia’s favorite sandwiches was an ice cream sandwich. Jacques was a stick of chocolate between two pieces of bread. Today, Julia’s favorite is the Croque Monsieur, or pressed and baked ham & cheese. Of course, Jacques provides a variation he calls a Croque Madam. A close second they can both agree on is the New England lobster roll, served on a toasted hot dog bun.

programme.title: Cucina Amore - Grilled Pork Tenderloin
programme.desc: Juicy pork tenderloin is stuffed with ham and cheese and served with tender stewed potatoes with tomatoes, onion and garlic.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - From Pueblo to City
programme.desc: Pati spends a day with one of Oaxaca’s best-known chefs and owner of Casa Oaxaca, Alex Ruiz. Alex takes Pati on a personal journey through his favorite market and family farm, showing her the Oaxaca that he knows and loves. In her kitchen, Pati creates some family friendly recipes inspired by her day with Alex and serves them to her son Juju.

programme.title: Foodie Guide to Québec City - Montcalm
programme.desc: Food columnist Allison Van Rassel takes you on a foodie tour of Montcalm in Québec City. Visit Morena, Gaël Vidricaire pastry shop and have a pint at Gallway, Montcalm's favourite Irish pub.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Chili Rice & Chicken a la Creole
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to cook Chili Rice & Chicken a la Creole!

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Molokai Traditions
programme.desc: Prior to western contact, Molokai was the most productive agricultural region of Hawaii. Today, local farmers are working to restore Molokai's role as the "bread basket" of Hawaii. "Molokai Traditions" visits with some of these farmers. Included in these visits are the restoration of an ancient Hawaiian fishpond. The series also visits with Dr. Terry Shintani, creator of a diet that emphasizes

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Sweet and Savory Toppings
programme.desc: The creamy delicious low-fat topping for many desserts used here by Graham in a melt-in-your-mouth Pear Fondue.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Empire Kitchen Pop’s for Italian Detroit Axe
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Musonda Mwila, Michael Sanders and Michelle Dritsan, who review bistro fare and craft cocktails at the Empire Kitchen true Italian fare with homemade pasta, of course, at Pop's for Italian and a casual menu of eats at the high-energy Detroit Axe restaurant.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Spicing Up Rice
programme.desc: Martin and his guest, Ming Tsai, kick off the evening with a “Mango Tango” and bring the house down by proving that rice doesn’t have to be the same old bland side dish.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Guillermo Thomas, Norman Van Aken, and Anne Quatrano
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pan-fried Soft-shell Crawfish and Eggplant, Pan-cooked Yellowtail with Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Kona Coffee Ice Cream Sandwich. Restaurants include: The Hermitage Hotel in Nashville, Norman’s in Miami, and Bacchanalia in Atlanta.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Pork Chronicles
programme.desc: As opposed to the lean-is-better preference in America, Koreans love their pork full of fat and, incidentally, full of flavor. On this episode, Marja, her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, and an expert food blogger named Daniel eat classic pork barbeque at Heukdonga restaurant in Seoul made with Jeju’s famous black pigs.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Sweet Nectar
programme.desc: In the remote reaches of Mexico, we learn how the world’s first organic fair trade honey is harvested. Chef Richard Sandoval, famed for his modern Mexican cuisine, wields a coa axe to show us how to tap the rare blue agave for its sweet syrup. With local ingredients in hand, it’s back to the kitchen where three generations of Sandoval’s prepare a Mexican feast with these sweet nectars.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Pork Chronicles
programme.desc: As opposed to the lean-is-better preference in America, Koreans love their pork full of fat and, incidentally, full of flavor. On this episode, Marja, her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, and an expert food blogger named Daniel eat classic pork barbeque at Heukdonga restaurant in Seoul made with Jeju’s famous black pigs.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Anoosh Shariat, Richard Chamberlain, and Doyle DeForest
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Portobello Napoleon, Peppered Beef Tenderloin, and Sacher Truffle Torte. Restaurants include: Shariat’s in Louisville, Chamberlain’s Chop House in Dallas, and Flour Power in New Orleans.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Betsy Ross Sews a Legend
programme.desc: Betsy Ross is one of the most celebrated women in American history. She was a woman of great courage who was asked by Gen. Washington to defy the British and secretly give our nation its identity. Learn why in this episode as Chef Staib prepares meals Betsy would have made, Oyster Stew and Roasted Duckling Glazed with Honey.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Lovers Only El Barzon The Rattlesnake Club
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Barbara Johnson, Jarod Robert and Elizabeth Kraft, who review upscale sandwiches and salads at Lovers Only Mexican and Italian specialties a la Chef Norberto Garita at El Barzon and steaks and seafood at the Rattlesnake Club located on the Detroit Riverfront.

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Braised Lamb Shanks and Polenta
programme.desc: Comfort food time: melt-in-your mouth lamb, rosemary and mushrooms baked in a cornmeal crust.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: With only 12-hours’ notice to attend a wedding in Tanzania’s capital city, it’s a good thing David is in Dar es Salaam, a major hub of fashion, textiles and trade on Africa’s East coast. Though he doesn’t manage to blend in with the locals at the wedding, he does get to sample the local food available at the Coco beach market, and to take a trip out of the bustling city to an easy-going fishing village to soak up its fresh seafood market. After spending time with a local hotel owner who built his entire property out of recycled and reclaimed materials, David revels in the laid-back attitude of these people and their tight-knit creative community.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: David speaks with several of the diaspora, Ethiopian-born people who have spent the majority of their lives abroad and have recently moved back to the capital city, Addis Ababa. He realizes that the true spirit of the country, with its reputation for poverty and famine, lies in the younger generations whose entrepreneurial drive and appreciation for preserving their unique culture are paving a new future for a modern Ethiopia.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: In the wake of a 7-year Italian occupation of Addis Ababa, a charming amount of Italian culture intertwines with the modern Ethiopia that the city now represents. David meets up with his friend Fabricio, a proud Italian who spent his childhood in Addis Ababa, and together they explore the remnants of a time long past. From espresso cafes to fine Italian eateries, Ethiopia’s capital has many unexpected surprises for Italians and Europeans alike.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Upon arriving in Zanzibar, a picturesque island known for its vast white sand beaches and its cultural melting-pot of African and Arabic culture, David is enchanted by the local people and their laid-back way of life. He meets a young business owner who builds houseboats and is gaining success in the tourism industry. Together they have fun cooking fresh local seafood for friends right on the boat. Later, David tours the winding streets and colourful markets of Stone Town with a couple of musicians and learns about the struggles of being a creative Muslim woman in this patriarchal society.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: David journeys off the beaten path in Zanzibar to the small fishing village of Jambiani, where the motto is “Pole-Pole” or “Slowly-slowly," and the people are warm and inviting. He spends the day with an Italian hotel owner who loved the island so much she made it her home 8 years ago. During his stay on the island, he witnesses the daily life of the locals, from seaweed harvesting in the vast shallow waters at low-tide, to spear fishing for fresh octopus, to grilling fresh seafood right on the beach.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Local Chef and foodie Andrew Draper takes David on a culinary journey through his hometown of Durban, South Africa. From trendy cafes to massive street markets, they get a taste of how the locals eat, with a focus on huge amounts of BBQ'D meats. Part of this food tour takes them up the coast to the beautiful Oyster Box Hotel, where David enjoys champagne to compliment fresh oysters harvested straight from the sea by the hotel manager himself. This culinary tour ends with a party and concert by the Durban Gospel Choir to celebrate Freedom Day, a national holiday in South Africa.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: With only 12-hours’ notice to attend a wedding in Tanzania’s capital city, it’s a good thing David is in Dar es Salaam, a major hub of fashion, textiles and trade on Africa’s East coast. programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke meets up with his older brother, Lewis, and his cousin, Kristoff, in Paris, where his cousins have lived for decades and now run their own newly opened Vietnamese restaurant.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke inspects the first round of baguettes fresh from the oven, at an award winning bakery in central Paris.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke heads to Strasbourg where he develops a taste for all things Alsatian and samples a local tart flambé.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke seeks some French connections to his Vietnamese roots, making a chicken dish fusing the two cultures in the eastern region of Franche-Comté.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke explores Lyon, the food capital of France, making a classic salad Lyonnaise and celebrating local food culture.

programme.title: Lee Chan's World Food Tour - Canada
programme.desc: Lee is rail hopping, road tripping and tasting her way through Canada's famous Rocky Mountains. Ending up in Vancouver, Lee celebrates Canada Day by cooking three of their national dishes.

programme.title: Lee Chan's World Food Tour - India
programme.desc: The land of spices welcomes Lee with open arms. With so much colour and spice at the centre of Indian culture, Lee decides to adopt some Indian fashion tips and dress up for the occasion

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Hip Hop Stilts
programme.desc: Harry doesn't know how to stilt walk but within 5 days he will have to crash course the basics and advance to hip-hop stilt-walking in order to perform to a critical audience in China.

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Rolling Lamp
programme.desc: Putting to the test all his muscles including scalp and tongue, Harry must balance a bowl of burning oil on his head while making a mockery of himself in a Sichuan opera.

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Lion Dance
programme.desc: Harry has to hold a horse stance, move like a cat and capture the spirit of the lion before he is allowed to perform Lion Dancing at a troupe's 190th anniversary celebrations.

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Man Juggling
programme.desc: Harry joins the Shandong Acrobatic Troupe famous for juggling with their feet fellow team mates to form a towering pyramid of men.

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Beijing Opera
programme.desc: Harry faces his toughest challenge yet as he puts aside his free-styling ways to conform to the precision moves required of the Monkey King character in Beijing Opera.

programme.title: Journy World Docs - Foundations
programme.desc: The Inca built the largest pre-Columbian empire in the Americas. In Foundations, Dr. Jago Cooper explores how they did it.

programme.title: Journy World Docs - Clash of Empires
programme.desc: By the early sixteenth century, the Inca had conquered the Andes and controlled a huge swathe of western South America. But within a year of arriving in Peru, a few hundred Spanish conquistadors had captured their capital, Cuzco. Dr. Jago Cooper explores the reasons for the Incas' fall.

programme.title: Journy World Docs - Easter Island: Mysteries of a Lost World
programme.desc: The contrast between the majestic statues of Easter Island and the desolation of their surroundings is stark. For decades, Easter Island has been seen as a warning for the planet as a whole: exhaust natural resources and the collapse of civilisation is inevitable. But Dr Jago Cooper believes that this is a disastrous misreading of what happened on Easter Island. Far from being a failure, the culture was a success story - and the real reasons for its demise were not the actions of its people.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When Daymond John of "Shark Tank" hires Josh Altman to find commercial space for his West Coast headquarters Altman moves his relationship to the back burner again. David and James coax a prolific developer to sell their newly built dream house for $12 995 000. As for Josh Flagg real estate is the last thing on his mind when his personal life is shattered.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Tracy travels to Dubai to earn a listing that could change her life, and hangs with friend and local celeb Caroline Stanbury. Altman hunts down a mystery property in Malibu to house dozens of luxury cars for an important client.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Flagg whisks boyfriend Bobby off to Paris to propose. Josh Altman takes on a listing with an unpredictable homeowner.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Altman throws an epic launch event for a modern with a 48-million-dollar price tag, and a social media twist. Tracy gets creative to find a buyer for her new WeHo modern in a market that is oversaturated with new construction.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James negotiates the purchase of the iconic Sunset Strip Hustler building. Josh Altman gets caught in a vulnerable position when an offer comes in on Carman Crest at an inopportune time.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A $13-million listing in Laguna Beach forces the Brits to sink-or-swim in a new territory. But they are buoyed by a surprise visit from a familiar face. Still reeling from the devastating loss of his grandmother, Josh Flagg struggles to stay focused on a new listing for one of Edith's friends. Josh Altman finds himself at a major cross-road: choosing to pursue a life-consuming $100-million listing, the biggest of his career, or spending more time with Heather to help mend their relationship.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles

programme.title: Ask TOH | Scorched Floor, Hardy Plantings
programme.desc: Ross tests out a new, smart stud finder Nathan travels to Portland, Oregon to repair an original wood floor that was burned from a face down hot iron Tom gives a general overview of a table saw and the best techniques to use it safely and effectively Jenn helps a homeowner replace and improve foundation plantings that have been crushed from snow piles.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Humidity Mystery, Brick Patch
programme.desc: Tom discusses the conversations a homeowner and a contractor should have before starting a renovation project Richard travels to Orlando to diagnose and repair an HVAC system that is creating way too much humidity Mauro demonstrates the technique for using a paint sprayer Mark travels to Denver to patch a hole in a brick wall.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Deck Staining, Water Monitoring
programme.desc: Tom demonstrates how to sharpen a knife Mauro teaches a homeowner how to re-stain her deck Mark demonstrates the best way to build a fire in order to prevent smoke from filling up the room in Future House, Ross travels to Los Angeles to learn about innovations being made to automatic water shutoff valves.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Historic Plantings, Wood Utensils
programme.desc: Jenn helps a homeowner add some curb appeal to his house using Victorian plants to match the design of his house the team shares more home inspection nightmares Mauro demonstrates how to accurately match a paint color Tom and Kevin hand carve wooden serving utensils using leftover pine from a previous Build It project.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | The Net-Zero Bungalow
programme.desc: Tom and Kevin cross the bridge from Newport, RI to Jamestown where they tour the next project – a 1920’s bungalow which will become a larger net zero house. They meet the family and builder. Richard and Kevin visit another net zero home. Demo begins.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Net Zero From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Shingles with asbestos are removed. Kevin visits a manufacturer in Pennsylvania that makes precast concrete walls. Homeowner Donald gives Kevin a historic tour of Jamestown.After the hole is prepped, the foundation wall panels arrive and are placed.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | HVAC of the Future
programme.desc: Jeff shows Kevin how he’s framing the net zero house. Richard demonstrates heat loss and gain to design a balanced HVAC system. He and Don visit the International Builders Show. Now that the house is open, Kevin can see the old wiring and plumbing.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | A Charleston Family House is Reborn
programme.desc: New apprentices join the team in Rhode Island as the roof goes up. The homeowners visit a cabinet showroom to finalize their plans. The house gets sheathed. It’s the finish line at Judith’s house in Charleston. Kevin and Tom take the grand tour.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Ramp Up the R Value
programme.desc: Insulation is crucial to a net zero house. Kevin finds Jeff and the apprentices starting the work. Dana shops for efficient yet decorative lighting. Tom and Jeff work with the apprentices to build false rafter tails and then they install them.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Net-Zero Blanket
programme.desc: Roof insulation is next step at the net zero house. Richard tours the basement of The Breakers in Newport. Kevin meets Congressman Norcross at the house, who is also an electrician. Apprentices install and flash windows.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Modern Barn Raising
programme.desc: The electrician installs a load center at the Idea House. Tom teaches the apprentices the correct application of cedar roof shingles. Kevin and Jeff add insulation to the basement. Tom shows Mary how to block behind walls with future cabinets and wall fixtures. A pre-cut post and beam barn gets raised.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Airtight House
programme.desc: Richard watches as the home is sealed against air leaks. Jeff reviews his pre-drywall checklist. Kevin sees the landscape plan. Jeff fabricates pieces for porch columns and rails. Tommy puts on shingles as the final layer of the exterior wall system

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Designing Their Dream Home
programme.desc: Dana and Don show Kevin interior design choices at their architecture studio. Richard demonstrates how a heat pump works. Mark watches as stone veneer is applied at the Idea House. The plumber installs a wall hung toilet tank inside the wall. Don builds his powder room vanity with Tom.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Powering Net Zero
programme.desc: Tom discusses the differences between hanging blue board and hanging drywall. Richard learns about the process to size a solar array. Jeff and Tommy install a wood ceiling. The electrician puts in a generator at the Idea House. Richard visits a Newport boat building school.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Roger's Nod to Sod
programme.desc: Roger visits a nearby sod farm with Jenn and Kevin. Richard inspects the HVAC installation. A gas fireplace goes in the living room. Tom and Jeff attach screens on the side porch. Outside, a new well is dug to provide water for the landscaping.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Energy-saving Installations
programme.desc: Kevin learns about induction cooking. Richard watches as the solar panels go on the barn roof. Outside, Jeff installs a unique lattice designed by Don. Richard demonstrates how an ERV works. Jenn finds the landscaping and hardscaping is well underway.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Net Zero Comes Together
programme.desc: The Net Zero house is complete. Kevin and Tom discuss challenges with Jeff. Don gives Kevin a tour of the yard and barn. Dana shows Tom the upstairs. He checks out the main floor with Don. Richard reviews mechanicals. All gather in the transformed kitchen at the end.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 3 Chefs Compete" - The final three contestants must prepare a meal for 100 of L.A.'s finest chefs. The winner gets a TV talk show appearance, while the losers must wash and iron the linens.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The two finalists must work with an architect to design restaurant spaces for their final dinner service competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The final two contestants square off in their last dinner service competition. The winner gets the head chef job at the Borgata Hotel, Casino and Spa in Atlantic City.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 16 Chefs Compete" - In part one of the season premiere, sixteen contestants get a shot at culinary stardom and an executive chef position in the Canadian resort town of Whistler, British Columbia.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 15 Chefs Compete" - In the final part of the season premiere, a contestant from season five returns and the fifteen remaining chefs prepare for a seafood-accented dinner service by deveining shrimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 14 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay wakes up the remaining chefs in the middle of the night and orders them to prepare a spaghetti dinner for hungry firefighters. The losers must wash and wax fire engines.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 13 Chefs Compete" - The contestants must craft perfectly proportioned sausages for celebrities Drew Lachey, John O'Hurley, Tom Green, Melinda Clarke, Christopher "Kid" Reid and Kristy Swanson.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 12 Chefs Compete" - The twelve remaining chefs must plan a gastronomic salute to a returning U.S. Marine. The losing team will have to clean and decorate for Tana Ramsay's party.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 11 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs must create three-course meals that only total 700 calories. The winners hit the beach with Olympic beach volleyball player Annett Davis.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 10 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs roll dice to determine which ingredients they will use for their challenge dish. The winning team earns a trip to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Anna Vincenzo's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Anna Vincenzo's, a family-run eatery in Boca Raton, Florida. He learns that the stubborn owner doesn't welcome change. After his ideas are ignored, Ramsay walks out.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Davide
programme.desc: Traveling to Boston's North End, Chef Ramsay spends a week at Davide, an Italian eatery mismanaged by feuding brothers.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Cafe Tavolini
programme.desc: While in Bridgeport, Connecticut, Chef Ramsay pays Cafe Tavolini a visit. Two lackadaisical owners watch as their eatery goes south.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Capri
programme.desc: While visiting the Eagle Rock area of Los Angeles, Chef Ramsay stops by Capri. This Italian restaurant is filthy, serves terrible food and is in disarray all thanks to a lazy set of twins.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Leone's
programme.desc: In Montclair, New Jersey, Chef Ramsay stops by Leone's, an Italian eatery that needs a major makeover.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mike and Nellie's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mike and Nellie's in New Jersey. With its putrid pasta sauces, overcooked shrimp plates, smelly carpets and dirty kitchen, Ramsay steps in to rejuvenate the joint.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Luigi's
programme.desc: In Anaheim, California, Chef Ramsay performs an extreme makeover on Luigi's. The Italian eatery faces management conflicts after the owner retires and leaves the business to his sons.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Charlie's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay pays Charlie's a visit. Located in La Verne, California, this Italian eatery suffers from a lackluster menu and outdated décor.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Chiarella's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay lends a helping hand to an Italian restaurant in Philadelphia that is hampered by a weak menu and poor service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Zocalo
programme.desc: In the season four finale, Chef Ramsay finds a befuddled staff and disappointing service at Zocalo, an Italian eatery in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hard Wear" - The designers strap on their "tool belts" to show off their "construction" skills. But as they prepare for the Runway, each designer fears they may end up in the bottom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''It's a Party'' - It's anything but party time when the designers get their Unconventional Materials Challenge: to make chic looks out of party supplies. But when the designers' models walk through the doors, the designers learn that there is a catch that may push them to their limits. The "Queen of Unconventional Fashion," Betsey Johnson, guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''My Pet Project'' - This year's Unconventional Materials Challenge lives up to its name when the designers arrive at a pet store. When Tim informs them that they will find all the materials they need inside, they quickly realize that this is their opportunity to show the judges how they can think outside the box. Stacey Bendet (Alice + Olivia) guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Candy Couture" - The designers participate in the always-anticipated Unconventional Materials Challenge of the season. This time around, the designers are tasked with making a garment entirely from items that are found in Dylan's Candy Bar.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Ultimate Hard and Soft" - The designers are tasked with the Unconventional Materials Challenge. Two of Project Runway's favorite challenges, the flower store and the hardware store, are combined for the ultimate "hard and soft" challenge. Also, the teams get a bit of a shake-up when two members leave one team and one member leaves another. The legendary Bette Midler serves as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "An Unconventional Coney Island" - The designers are taken to Coney Island and split into teams of two for the Yoplait Challenge. After asking patrons to describe different flavors of yogurt, they must then use these descriptive words as inspiration for their Runway look. The catch? The only fabric allowed in this challenge are from prizes they win at Coney Island.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "You Choose Your Materials!" - For their second Team Challenge of the season, the designers are divided into four teams of three and told they are making a 3-piece mini collection inspired by their assigned Lexus Sedan. However, this is also an Unconventional Materials Challenge, so the designers must drive their Lexus' to various predetermined locations of their choosing in order to shop for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: The seven remaining designers play naughty or nice in the fan-favorite Unconventional Materials Challenge that brings them to a Christmas decor emporium.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "Keepin' It Classy " - It's back to school for the remaining eight designers in this fan-favorite Unconventional Materials Challenge to create high impact fashion from materials found in an elementary classroom. Guest judges are actors Michael Urie and Gabourey Sidibe.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "The Art of Construction" - A construction site forces designers to create feminine fashion from masculine materials for the notorious Unconventional Materials Challenge. Snooki and JWoww join the judges.

programme.title: Verdad Oculta: Episodio 41
programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. Su jefe, sin embargo, tiene otros planes y le asigna al coronel Diana su mayor misión hasta la fecha: desmantelar "el Clan del Norte" dirigido por los hermanos Zurria y sus aliados oficiales corruptos y funcionarios del gobierno.

programme.title: Ten 1 EP01
programme.desc: Tape Murder Case Part.1 A half-naked body of a woman brutally murdered with the tape wrapped around her face is found. Having no clues, Ji-hoon finds its similarity to ""Ghost Case,"" an unsolved case 7 years ago. However, the advent of Kim Eun-young, who exactly looks like Seo Eun-bi, confuses the investigation. Then, four detectives started from different cases, investigate the case together.

programme.desc: Tape Murder Case Part.2 A half-naked body of a woman brutally murdered with the tape wrapped around her face is found. programme.title: Ten 1 EP04
programme.desc: The Visit of the Strangers Four family members are brutally murdered in a luxurious house. All the victims are found dead in their own rooms. The only survivor is a 70-year-old grandmother with Alzheimer's, and she can't remember a single thing. As the detectives dig into the case, the secrets of this family are revealed.

programme.title: Love H2O
programme.desc: When a romance columnist is unceremoniously dumped for another woman, she finds comfort in three different guys--but which one to bring as a date to her ex's wedding?

programme.title: Mood Of The Day
programme.desc: A woman in a stalled relationship sits next to a charming womanizer on a train, and he's immediately determined to seduce her. They've got 24 hours to spend in a strange city together. Will he succeed?

programme.title: Last Cinderella: The Forbidden Kiss
programme.desc: Sakura's worried she might be pregnant.

programme.title: Last Cinderella: E05
programme.desc: Sakura's younger brother comes to visit, while Chiyoko tries to go on a date with Rintaro.

programme.title: New Trial
programme.desc: A murder of a taxi driver that turned Korea upside down. The lone witness was a teenager named Hyun-woo who was later forced into making a false confession by abusive cops. Ten years have passed, and Hyun-woo has spent almost half of his life in prison. When Joon-young, a desperate lawyer, learns of Hyun-woo’s case, he instinctively sees an opportunity. However, once Joon-young meets Hyun-woo in person, he feels the passion he had when he first dreamed of becoming a lawyer.

programme.title: Miss Conspirator
programme.desc: When a women with a panic disorder gets entangled in a 44 million dollars drug deal gone wrong, she is forced to cope with her phobia as police and mafia track her down.

programme.title: The Age Of Blood
programme.desc: A battle between traitors conspiring coup d'etat and Joseon’s greatest swordsman has begun! Kim Ho, Korea’s greatest swordsman, gets demoted from the royal palace guard to a prison officer. One day, during a chaotic riot in the prison, five armed men try to break free Lee In-jwa, who’s been imprisoned for a conspiracy against the king. Kim Ho realizes that he alone can save the king in the palace where most of king’s people have turned.

programme.title: One Day
programme.desc: Kang-soo, an insurance investigator, has lost all the hope and purpose of living after his wife died. One day, the company gives him the case of Mi-so, a girl who’s fallen into a coma from a car accident. At the hospital he goes to investigate the case, he meets a girl who claims that she is Mi-so, who in reality can’t walk or talk. Kang-soo eventually comes to accept that for some reason only he can see the spirit of Mi-so. And Mi-so asks Kang-soo to help her biggest wish come true before she has to leave this world for good.

programme.title: That Girl

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Call of the Wild" - A commercial director tells Anne she has a face that no housewife would feel threatened by, which makes her wonder if she has any sex appeal.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: ARE WE THERE YET? revolves around divorced mother Suzanne who is newly married to former athlete Nick. The newly blended Kingston-Person family is working to adapt to the new family dynamics.

programme.title: Portlandia: Feminist Bookstore 10th Anniversary
programme.desc: The 10th anniversary party for Toni and Candace's feminist bookstore is interrupted by a surprise guest. Guest stars Penny Marshall, LaMarcus Aldridge.

programme.title: Portlandia: Brunch Village
programme.desc: Portland's hottest brunch spot welcomes all the residents of Portlandia... but there's a wait. Guest stars Tim Robbins Kyle MacLachlan, Steve Jones.

programme.title: Portlandia: Portlandia: The Brunch Special
programme.desc: The wait for brunch with Fred and Carrie is even longer in this one-hour edition of Portlandia's "Brunch Village." This special episode takes a behind-the-scenes peek at Director Jonathan Krisel's journey to find the perfect Marionberry Pancake.

programme.title: Portlandia: Winter In Portlandia
programme.desc: It's wintertime in Portlandia. Peter and Nance struggle to keep off winter weight by cutting pasta from their diets. Candace's son (Bobby Moynihan) visits Women and Women First bookstore for the holidays.

programme.title: Portlandia: Take Back Mtv
programme.desc: In this Season 3 premiere, Spyke & Iris join forces with a gang of former MTV stars to take back MTV from the Tweens. A group of frustrated college grads stage a protest on the dance floor. Sandra has a crush on a man in her meditation class.

programme.title: Portlandia: Missionaries
programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland. A pedicab driver hustles for clients. Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.title: Portlandia: Nina'S Birthday
programme.desc: Nina goes to great lengths to throw an extravagant 32nd birthday party for herself. The daylong event is set to include activities ranging from horseback rides to sunrise yoga that will last well into the night.

programme.title: Portlandia: Squiggleman
programme.desc: Concerned parents Brendan and Michelle start a band that makes kids music. The Portland Nerd Council issues a Public Service Announcement. Malcolm & Kris have an uncomfortable lunch at a vegan restaurant. The Feminist Bookstore hosts a comedy night.

programme.title: Portlandia: Off The Grid
programme.desc: Following an environmental scandal, The Mayor steps down from office and moves off the grid. A dolphin discovers that plastic bags have been banned in Portland. Musicians compete in a Battle of the Gentle Bands.

programme.title: Portlandia: The Temp
programme.desc: A temp worker hopes to turn her gig as Interim Mayor of Portland into a full-time job with Fred and Carrie's help. A wedding is interrupted. Local baristas draft a coffee shop manifesto. Kath and Dave struggle to find a table at a restaurant.

programme.title: Portlandia: Soft Opening
programme.desc: Peter and Nance practice hosting friends at the "Soft Opening" of their Bed and Breakfast. A magazine features a local furniture maker in their "Man Issue." Steampunks attend a convention. Fred takes a love interest on a bold third date.

programme.title: Portlandia: Alexandra
programme.desc: The City of Portland is overrun with art projects. Fred and Carrie's relationship is complicated by their roommate, Alexandra. A movie theater sells artisanal concessions. The consultants from "Japanese Toys, Cool Offices" get to work.

programme.title: Portlandia: No-Fo-O-Fo-Bridge
programme.desc: The Rats decide to move out of their newly gentrified neighborhood. First-time parents read various child-rearing books. Gahvin and his girlfriend go to the movies. Carrie and Alexandra have dinner at a communal table.

programme.title: Portlandia: Blackout
programme.desc: Electricity is shut off for the entire City of Portland due to unpaid bills at the Mayor's Office. Peter and Nance have a mysterious guest at their bed and breakfast. Kath and Dave go into survival mode.

programme.title: Portlandia: Sharing Finances
programme.desc: A young woman (Kirsten Dunst) is haunted by very informed ghosts. Doug and Claire make a big commitment to one another. Kath and Dave make the most of fifteen minutes. Sandra finally finds a soulmate. Fred is visited by a Date Fact Checker.

programme.title: Portlandia: Ecoterrorists
programme.desc: Ecoterrorists (including Olivia Wilde) protest animal testing at makeup company. Bryce and Lisa Rent it Out! Toni and Candace have a car wash. Fred misses hip hop.

programme.title: Portlandia: Celery
programme.desc: A celery salesman (Steve Buscemi) goes to great lengths to get celery back on the table. 911 dispatchers assure callers that it's beets. The Order Grill is open for lunch. Carrie declares social bankruptcy.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Lindsey and Kevin give to a charity, but Nick must step in when the charity keeps asking for more money.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Nick and Suzanne plan to attend a high-profile movie premiere, but their busy schedules create complications.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Nick retaliates after he overhears Suzanne telling personal information to Gigi.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: The spread of certain secrets could ruin two newfound romances.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Nick and Suzanne consider purchasing life insurance.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?

programme.title: AFV's Up All Night

programme.title: AFV's Top 10 Late Night Laughs Countdown: Night Time LOL's
programme.desc: Episode 105 - What are you still up? Late nights are the perfect time to sit back, relax, and laugh. Join Janell Lenfert as she brings you the Top 10 funniest videos for your Late Night Laughs.

programme.title: AFV Family's Bonehead Brigade Countdown: Caught On Camera
programme.desc: Episode 105 - ATTEN-SHUN! Welcome to the Bonehead Brigade, if you bumble, stumble, fall, flip or fail, we want you! Our mission? To save the world, one belly laugh at a time!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Drew Barth - Shoulda Tried Harder
programme.desc: Drew Barth is one of the fastest rising comedy stars in the Northwest. Born just outside the city of Seattle, what started as a dare in high school has become a full-time career. Drew Barth has risen through the ranks of local open mics to become a regular performer at comedy clubs, colleges, casinos and private events up and down the West Coast. After making the finals of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Drew Barth spent a great deal of time in Los Angeles performing at clubs such as The Comedy Store, Laugh Factory, and The Improv, honing his craft.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Seth Tippetts - Tall. Dark. Gigante
programme.desc: Get to know Seth from the chest down. He’s big, he’s tall, but most of all he’s hilarious. Check out this Utah-raised, clean, and semi-professional comedian today!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jeff Capri - Capricious
programme.desc: Jeff Capri uses his cynical perspective to riff on oxygen bars, playing darts to get in shape, and men taking their shirts off before fights.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Michael Palascak - 1984
programme.desc: Michael Palascak's dry humor shines with riffs on interviewing for a pyramid scheme, living with his parents after college, and how life is way better now than in 1984.

programme.title: Collin Moulton - Anti-Animal Vegan
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jordan Makin - The BFFG
programme.desc: Born and raised in the heart of Utah County, Jordan Makin had to compensate for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny. His unique observations will make you laugh and his stories about feeling awkward will help you appreciate your life more. He has worked with many comedy greats, such as Marc Maron, Ryan Hamilton, and Drew Lynch. His comedy has been featured at the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival and the Idaho Laugh Fest. Jordan is the co-creator and co-host of The Happy Valley Podcast.

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight
programme.desc: The christian comic is married to his high school sweetheart, who later became his stepsister through the marriage of their parents to each other. That’s where the fun begins as Moody skillfully shares his life experiences.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Christopher Lawrence - Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Mark Christopher Lawrence (born May 22, 1964) is an American character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist. He is perhaps best known for his role as esoteric D.J., Tone Deaf, in the 1994 satirical rap mockumentary, Fear of a Black Hat. He has co-starred in popular films such as Terminator 2: Judgment Day, Planet of the Apes, Lost Treasure and The Pursuit of Happiness. Lawrence can currently be seen in his regular role as Big Mike on the NBC series Chuck. He has made guest appearances on many television programs, most notably Heroes, My Name Is Earl, Crossing Jordan, Dharma & Greg, Malcolm in the Middle, Touched by an Angel, Malcolm & Eddie, Men Behaving Badly, Seinfeld, Murphy Brown, and Martin. He is also featured on the Radio Series Adventures in Odyssey as "Ed Washington".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Chris Voth - Cashmere
programme.desc: Chris Voth is an accomplished comedian, a licensed teacher, and a published author. Voth made his debut late-night television appearance on the Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson. He also appeared in three seasons of NBC's Last Comic Standing and was chosen for the prestigious Great American Comedy Festival. A 15-year comedy veteran, Voth is a past winner of the Denver Comedy Works Competition and has worked with everyone from Dave Chappelle to Larry the Cable Guy to Linda Ronstadt. Voth’s first comedy CD titled "Never Mind the Jim J Bullocks, Here's the Chris Voth" is currently available for purchase. Chris currently balances his performance schedule with his full-time high-school teaching career. You can read his short story, "Stand Up and Deliver," published in the Cream City Review Literary Journal. In it, Chris shares the experiences he had when entering the teaching field after years in stand-up comedy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Rex Havens - Women & Children First
programme.desc: Rex has been delighting comedy audiences for 20 years, in world-famous comedy clubs like The Improv, Catch-A-Rising Star, Funny Bones and Zanies, on television for Showtime, Comedy Central and Comic Relief, on radio with Bob & Tom and NPR, cruise ships worldwide, and corporate clients including GM, American Express, Texaco, 3M, Coca-Cola, IBM, Toshiba, Lowe’s, Johnson & Johnson, Ameritech, Proctor & Gamble, State Farm, Quaker Oats, Verizon and the IRS (“Working for the IRS is the only sure way to get money from them.”), and numerous non-profit and charitable organizations, such as St. Jude’s and the Make-A-Wish Foundation. A former college professor who made the unusual transition to the standup comedy stage in the ’80’s, Rex has always believed that laughter is the best defense against a confusing and challenging world. Rex’s take on marriage and family has propelled him to performances in all 50 states and around the world, including London, Hong Kong, Amsterdam, Bermuda, Montreal, Barcelona, Copenhagen, Aruba, Rome and Cannes.

programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this cheesy 80's horror classic! When four baloonists crash land on a remote island, one thing is for sure: they have a dog named Melvin! Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they take a trip to Frankenstein Island!

programme.title: The Sharksons Love Music!
